thread.title: Cubs, Players Thank Fans on Social Media
thread.title_full: Cubs, Players Thank Fans on Social Media

author: JAMES NEVEAU
title: Cubs, Players Thank Fans on Social Media
text:
Privacy Policy | More Newsletters The Chicago Cubs’ roster is loaded with players who are active on social media, and after the team was eliminated from the postseason on Wednesday against the New York Mets, many players took to Twitter to thank fans for their support. Anthony Rizzo, who gave away tickets to fans throughout the postseason, had some words of encouragement as the team begins the offseason: I couldn't be prouder of my team and all of our accomplishments this year...don't worry we'll be back — Anthony Rizzo (@ARizzo44) October 22, 2015 Kyle Schwarber, who slugged five home runs in the postseason, thanked fans: Thank you to all of the @Cubs fans for a great year and an awesome experience! You guys truly are the best fans in baseball! — Kyle Schwarber (@kschwarb12) October 22, 2015 Kyle Hendricks doesn’t tweet very often, but he did hop on social media to thank fans: What a year. Thank you for everything Cubs fans — Kyle Hendricks (@kylehendricks28) October 22, 2015 David Ross joined in on the thank you’s as well: @Cubs Fans, THANK YOU! — David Ross (@D_Ross3) October 22, 2015 Dan Haren, who didn’t pitch in the postseason but was with the team down the stretch, is retiring, and he thanked fans for their support: Thank you baseball. I played this beautiful game for 30 years. I took my jersey off for the last time tonight. It was an honor. #ithrew88 — dan haren (@ithrow88) October 22, 2015 Jorge Soler chimed in shortly after the Cubs’ elimination: Thank you Cubs fans for an incredible year! #SolerPower — Jorge Soler (@JorgeSoler68) October 22, 2015 We’ll give the Cubs the final word: — Chicago Cubs (@Cubs) October 22, 2015 
Published 2 hours ago
